top_categories.workout_context: Total Tomahawk Terrain's northwoods gravel roads rewards steady threshold power. Surging and recovering costs more watts than just holding.
Total Tomahawk Terrain's Gravel roads, Northwoods terrain forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 62 miles.
At Total Tomahawk Terrain, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Total Tomahawk Terrain. Train it until it feels boring.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Total Tomahawk Terrain's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before June.
62 miles on northwoods gravel roads burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Varied gradients on northwoods gravel roads demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
When someone attacks on northwoods gravel roads, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Total Tomahawk Terrain, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Base fitness for Total Tomahawk Terrain. Without this, the hard workouts break you down instead of building you up.
Low-cadence force work for 3,000ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Total Tomahawk Terrain’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Total Tomahawk Terrain requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on northwoods gravel roads to build confidence. Expect: gravel roads, northwoods terrain, rolling hills.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 62 miles of northwoods gravel roads in Tomahawk, Wisconsin.
